author: Special Correspondent
text:
Asks supporters of both parties whether they accept the ‘illogical’ tie-up

Underlining the ideological differences between the Congress and the Left Front in West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday posed a question to supporters of both the opposition parties “whether they accept the illogical alliance” of erstwhile rivals.

Addressing her first proper election rally in Malda district, Ms. Banerjee said, “For those who are still with the Congress and the Left it is also a question of their ideologies.”

Describing the alliance as “unholy and opportunistic,” the Chief Minister said that over 50,000 Congress workers were killed during the CPI(M) rule and now both the parties had come together for an alliance. “They should be ashamed of themselves,” she said.
title: Left-Cong. tie-up opportunistic, says Mamata
